page.title: 04Changes Since 1860
page.content:
In comparing the present situation with the O.S. old series map of 1860 it is apparent that the land on the coastal strip has been much improved over the last 100 years. the old map shows several streams crossing the fields, whilst now they have been diverted into well defined channels thereby improving the drainage and usefulness of the land. There is also evidence that some sea defence work has been carried out over the years in the form of an embankment along the shore.
All information compiled by pupils of Hillgrove School, Bangor, Gwynedd. Written by{Jonathan Porter}and{Stephen {Berry. { {
